title: Finance Industry Interview Guide
description: Navigate the unique expectations and culture of financial services interviews.

content.text: Financial services operate under intense scrutiny with high stakes. The culture reflects this reality—precision, professionalism, and risk awareness are paramount.

**Core finance values:**

- **Attention to detail** - Small errors have massive consequences
- **Risk management** - Always consider downside scenarios
- **Client trust** - Relationships are everything
- **Intellectual rigor** - Back everything with analysis
- **Composure under pressure** - Markets don't wait for you to feel ready
Finance interviews often test how you handle pressure. Expect rapid-fire questions, mental math, and scenarios designed to see how you react when challenged.
Finance interviews are notoriously rigorous. Depending on the role, you may face technical assessments, case studies, and 'Superday' interview marathons.

**Common formats by role:**

- **Investment Banking**: Technical questions, deal experience, fit interviews, often multiple rounds in one day
- **Trading**: Mental math, market scenarios, brain teasers, risk questions
- **Asset Management**: Stock pitches, portfolio discussion, market views
- **Fintech**: Mix of tech and finance, product sense, technical skills
For traditional finance roles, dress conservatively (suit and tie). Fintech is more relaxed, but when in doubt, err on the side of formality.
You'll be expected to discuss current market conditions intelligently. This doesn't mean predicting the future—it means showing you follow markets and can think critically.

items.text: Check major indices (S&P 500, Dow, NASDAQ, relevant international)
Know key interest rates (Fed funds rate, 10-year Treasury)
Be ready to discuss 2-3 stocks or market trends

content.text: I don't care if you're bullish or bearish. I care if you can defend your view with logic and data.
content.author: Portfolio Manager, Major Asset Manager

content.text: Technical knowledge expectations vary by role, but some fundamentals apply broadly across finance.

items.text: Financial statements (income statement, balance sheet, cash flow)
